Title:
Two new corticioid species: Hyphoderma sinense and H.
floccosum spp. nov. (Hyphodermataceae, Polyporales) from southern
China
Keywords:
ITS, molecular phylogeny, new taxon, taxonomy,
wood-rotting fungi
Abstract:
Two new corticioid fungal species, Hyphoderma sinense and
H. floccosum spp. nov., are proposed based on a combination of
morphological features and molecular evidence from Yunnan Province,
southwestern China. Hyphoderma sinense is characterized by the
resupinate basidiomata with smooth hymenial surface, presence of
encrusted and moniliform cystidia, and cylindrical to allantoid
basidiospores measuring as 811.5×35µm. Hyphoderma floccosum is
characterized by the farinaceous hymenial surface, tubular cystidia and
leptocystidia, and ellipsoid to allantoid basidiospores. Sequences of
ITS+nLSU nrRNA gene regions of the studied samples were generated and
phylogenetic analyses were performed with maximum likelihood, maximum
parsimony and Bayesian inference methods. These phylogenetic analyses
based on molecular data of ITS+nLSU sequences showed that two new
species clustered into Hyphoderma, in which H. sinense grouped with H.
transiens, and H. floccosum grouped with a clade comprising H. pinicola,
H. setigerum and H. subsetigerum. The new taxa are described,
illustrated, and compared and contrasted to morphologically similar
species. An identification key to 23 accepted species in China is
provided.
